website_summaries.verdict: It's pricey, but this award-winning children's sunscreen is ideal for ultra-sensitive skin that's prone to breakouts and allergic reactions.

customer_reviews.title: Great sun block
customer_reviews.text: Great sun block. This brand has been shown to be superior to other sun screen in terms of ingredients, quality, and SPF. It's a little more expensive, but is your child not worth it? Skimp in other areas, don't cheap out when it comes to health or safety.
customer_reviews.author: Gventro

customer_reviews.title: Goes on white, but gets absorbed; great for water
customer_reviews.text: I use this sunscreen on my 2.5-year-old. It goes on white, but gets absorbed after a few (ten?) minutes. It does "transfer" some: it leaves purple-film looking spots on the brown leather couch where he touches it before the sunscreen gets absorbed (which can be cleaned using a baby wipe). This is the best sunscreen I've tried for water play, as it lasts a long time and I can see the water beading up on top of my son's skin.
customer_reviews.author: KMJ

customer_reviews.title: Best sunscreen out there for use in water
customer_reviews.text: I've tried (and compared side-by-side) most of the chemical-free sunscreens on the market for my child and in my view this is the best one for use in water. It's probably a bit too hard to wipe off for daily use - what we do is have one sunscreen for daily use and one for use in water - but for water, it's stays on well and is not lumpy or oily like some of the others. Like most of the sunscreens that are based on titanium dioxide it is fairly "white" in appearance when applied, but that's a small price to pay to protect your kids from the sun...and harmful chemicals! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Best kids sunblock ever.
customer_reviews.text: It is thick but my kids have never been sunburned. They are very pale kids (7 years and going strong). I won't use anything else!
customer_reviews.author: BillyDoc

customer_reviews.title: Sale price but quick expiration
customer_reviews.text: This one star review has nothing to do with the quality of the product but the expiration date. Got this on sale but the product expiration is two months from now. My very useful as we are in the middle of winter and are hardly needing sunblock.
customer_reviews.author: booyahbagwells

customer_reviews.title: Way pricey, but I'll never use another.
customer_reviews.text: I have serious sensitivity to perfumes, odors, etc. I don't wear sunscreen myself as a consequence. And even just putting sunscreen on my daughter tends to make me ill. I finally broke down and sprung for this stuff after reading tons of reviews, EWG's reports, and scouring the internet to try to find sunscreen that wouldn't sicken me. This is it. Like many of these sunscreens, this can be a bit challenging to rub in and, if your kid squirms, may leave a greasy or chalky sheen. Such is life with no ozone layer. This keeps her unburned and the odor, while detectable during application, fades quickly. Glad I finally found it and I won't stray.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for adults too.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for adults too. I have skin issues with zinc oxide and found there are no spf products on the market that only have titanium dioxide except for this one. It works really well but remember to reapply as often as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Awful, baby got badly sunburned
customer_reviews.text: I slathered this on my baby 30 minutes before we went outside. I bought it because it was supposed to be safer than others. He burned terribly.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C

customer_reviews.title: Got this to use on my little white dog around ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use on my little white dog around her eyes. She is not a fan of me applying it and the other dog wants to lick it off. Does well in out bright summer days on the desert. Kinda spendy but you only need a small amount so it should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: G Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my super-fair daughter!
customer_reviews.text: I have a red-headed, fair skinned 9 month old who just went on her first trip to the beach. EVERYTHING aggravates her pretty porcelain skin. I read the reviews and bought this. Yes, it was a little more difficult to rub in than other sunscreens I have used, but it didn't break her out and she came home just as fair as the day she left. I love this and will buy plenty more to get us through the long Mississippi summer.
customer_reviews.author: Alli K

customer_reviews.title: THis is not an organic product.
customer_reviews.text: searched for organic sunscreen for my 3-year old. Although the Amazon web site has the organic word appears in the page. but there is not a single appearance of the word Organic on the product received. I realized that in order to make it an organic certified. At least 95% of the ingredients of the product has to be organic. So, this product only contain some organic ingredients but it is not an Organic certified product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Xu

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sunblock for baby and adult face
customer_reviews.text: Expensive sunblock, but it is a very good quality. I was recommended by my baby's Pediatrician. A small amount use can cover the whole body of the baby. I also use it on my face. It doesn't feel thick or too greasy.
customer_reviews.author: Kepaco

customer_reviews.title: No allergies
customer_reviews.text: We've tried every sunscreen out there to no avail. My son always has an allergic reaction to sunscreens--except this one. This thick sunscreen applies easily. A little goes a long way, so don't let the small size deter you. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Spiro
